title: Glenn Youngkin
deleted: Youngkin opposes [[LGBT rights in Virginia|LGBT rights]], [[Same-sex marriage in Virginia|same-sex marriage]], [[Immigration to the United States|immigrant rights]], a [[Minimum wage in the United States#Virginia|minimum wage]], [[Affordable housing by country#United States|affordable housing]], [[Climate change in Virginia#Climate policy in Virginia|environmental policies to combat climate change]], [[Health care in the United States|affordable health care]], [[Gun laws in Virginia|gun control]], and the [[Cannabis in Virginia|legalization of cannabis]]. {{Citation needed}}

title: Glenn Youngkin
added: Youngkin said he doesn't know what causes [[climate change]] and the cause doesn't matter, but it is a challenge he'd like to fix. Youngkin said he would not have signed Virginia's Clean Economy Act.<ref>{{cite news |last=Hankerson |first=Mechelle |date=12 October 2021 |title=What Virginia gubernatorial candidates say about sea level rise |url=https://whro.org/news/local-news/23546-what-virginia-gubernatorial-candidates-say-about-sea-level-rise |url-status=live |work=[[WHRO-TV]] |location= |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211013133403/https://whro.org/news/local-news/23546-what-virginia-gubernatorial-candidates-say-about-sea-level-rise |archive-date=13 October 2021 |access-date=25 October 2021}}</ref>

title: Glenn Youngkin
added: Asked if he accepts the scientific consensus on the causes of climate change, Youngkin said he doesn't know what causes [[climate change]] and that the cause ultimately does not matter. He said he would not have signed Virginia's Clean Economy Act (which calls for Virginia’s carbon emissions to reach zero by 2050).<ref>{{cite news |last=Hankerson |first=Mechelle |date=12 October 2021 |title=What Virginia gubernatorial candidates say about sea level rise |url=https://whro.org/news/local-news/23546-what-virginia-gubernatorial-candidates-say-about-sea-level-rise |url-status=live |work=[[WHRO-TV]] |location= |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211013133403/https://whro.org/news/local-news/23546-what-virginia-gubernatorial-candidates-say-about-sea-level-rise |archive-date=13 October 2021 |access-date=25 October 2021}}</ref>

title: Glenn Youngkin
added: Asked if he accepts the[[Scientific consensus on climate change|scientific consensus on the causes of climate change]], Youngkin said he doesn't know what causes [[climate change]] and that the cause ultimately does not matter.<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite web|title=2021 Race for Governor: Virginia Roundtable Discussion|url=https://www.wavy.com/video/2021-race-for-governor-virginia-roundtable-discussion/7047010/|access-date=2021-10-26|website=WAVY.com|language=en-US}}</ref>He said he would not have signed Virginia's Clean Economy Act (which calls for Virginia’s carbon emissions to reach zero by 2050).<refname=":1">{{cite news |last=Hankerson |first=Mechelle |date=12 October 2021 |title=What Virginia gubernatorial candidates say about sea level rise |url=https://whro.org/news/local-news/23546-what-virginia-gubernatorial-candidates-say-about-sea-level-rise |url-status=live |work=[[WHRO-TV]] |location= |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211013133403/https://whro.org/news/local-news/23546-what-virginia-gubernatorial-candidates-say-about-sea-level-rise |archive-date=13 October 2021 |access-date=25 October 2021}}</ref>

title: Glenn Youngkin
added: When seeking the Republican nomination for governor, Youngkin for months refused to acknowledge that[[JoeBiden]]hadwon the presidency legitimately.Youngkin dodged or deflected questions on the subject, which became an issue after Trump [[Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election|refusedtoaccepthis defeat by Biden]]. After Youngkin won the Republican nomination, he shifted his position, stating that Biden was the legitimate president.<ref>{{cite news |first=Ned |last=Oliver |url=https://www.virginiamercury.com/blog-va/after-months-of-refusing-to-say-biden-won-legitimately-youngkin-says-of-course/ |title=After months of refusing to say Biden won legitimately, Youngkin says, 'Of course.' |newspaper=[[Virginia Mercury]] |date=May 12, 2021 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210801053300/https://www.virginiamercury.com/blog-va/after-months-of-refusing-to-say-biden-won-legitimately-youngkin-says-of-course/ |archive-date=August 1, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |first=Warren |last=Fiske |url=https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2021/may/19/glenn-youngkin/youngkin-shifts-position-legitimacy-bidens-electio/ |title=Youngkin shifts position on the legitimacy of Biden's election |work=[[PolitiFact]] |date=May 19, 2021 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211022140931/https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2021/may/19/glenn-youngkin/youngkin-shifts-position-legitimacy-bidens-electio/ |archive-date=October 22, 2021}}</ref> Youngkin has continued to emphasize "election integrity" as a major campaign issue and supports stricter voting laws, such as a photo ID requirement.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Vozzella|first=Laura|date=August 6, 2021|title=Youngkin’s tricky dance with ‘election integrity’ complicates run for Virginia governor|language=en-US|work=Washington Post|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/virginia-politics/youngkin-virginia-election-integrity-rally/2021/08/06/1cf4407a-f538-11eb-9738-8395ec2a44e7_story.html|access-date=2021-10-26|issn=0190-8286}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=Elwood|first=Karina|date=October 6, 2021|title=As Virginia election draws near, GOP’s Youngkin continues campaigning on ‘election integrity’|language=en-US|work=Washington Post|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2021/10/06/youngkin-election-audit-virginia-governor/|access-date=2021-10-26|issn=0190-8286}}</ref>

title: Glenn Youngkin
added: Although Youngkin rejects [[Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election|the false claim that Donald Trump won the 2020 presidential election]], he has embraced [[Trumpism]] as a political movement and refused to acknowledge the legitimacy of [[Joe Biden]]'s presidency until after securing the Republican gubernatorial nomination. Youngkin supports the [[COVID-19 vaccine]] but opposes mask and vaccine mandates. His campaign has drawn national media attention for its education platform,  which has emphasized a socially conservative approach to the treatment of transgender students and opposition to [[critical race theory]].

title: Glenn Youngkin
deleted: Although Youngkin rejects [[Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election|the false claim that Donald Trump won the 2020 presidential election]], he has embraced [[Trumpism]] as a political movement and refused to acknowledge the legitimacy of [[Joe Biden]]'s presidency until after securing the Republican gubernatorial nomination. Youngkin supports the [[COVID-19 vaccine]] but opposes mask and vaccine mandates.

title: Glenn Youngkin
deleted: Trump supports Youngkin, who like him, is part of the conspiracy to install shape shifters in key positions, while promoting the ideas that Democrats are endangering the freedoms and power of the United States.

title: Glenn Youngkin
deleted: Glenn Youngkin defeated Creepy Clintonite Terry McAuliffe in an enormous upset. For months, the liberal mainstream media had said the Virginia would never vote for a Republican and that Terry would win in a rout, but they had no idea how much BACKLASH and OUTRAGE the Democrat party had stirred. All over the great Commonwealth, people were fed up with the far-left agenda of Joe Biden, the most unpopular and hated president in American history. While Joe and Terry were pushing Critical Race Theory, Virginians realized that Democrat socialist policies had wrecked the economy, skyrocketed inflation, and created shortages of anything and everything. Then, in an act of total desperation, Terry and his campaign disgracefully tried to slander Glenn Youngkin as a Neo-Nazi. The people of Virginia were not fooled by these lies, however, and Glenn won BIG, proving that a massive RED WAVE had begun for Republicans across the country!
